22-0794.summary: Recommendation to receive and file notice of adjournment of the June 14, 2022 regular meeting of the Housing Authority of the City of Long Page 1 of 4411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 4:45 PMTUESDAY, JULY 12, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHHOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF LONG BEACH, CALIFORNIA MINUTESBeach, California.A motion was made by Commissioner Allen, seconded by Commissioner Uranga, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and Zendejas2.

22-0795.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Housing Authority of the City of Long Beach, California Regular Meeting held Tuesday,May 10, 2022.A motion was made by Vice Chair Saro, seconded by Commissioner Austin, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and Zendejas3.

22-0796.summary: Recommendation to receive and file the Housing Authority Financial and Operational Performance Reports for March 2022.  (Citywide)Chair Zendejas spoke.Alison King, Deputy Executive Director/Bureau Manager, spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner Richardson, seconded by Commissioner Mungo, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and Zendejas4.

OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 4:45 PMTUESDAY, JULY 12, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHHOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF LONG BEACH, CALIFORNIA MINUTESA motion was made by Commissioner Mungo, seconded by Commissioner Austin, to approve recommendation. 22-0798.summary: Recommendation to receive and file the presentation of the 2020-2021 Housing Authority Family Self-Sufficiency Graduates.  (Citywide)This Agenda Item was withdrawn.6.

22-0799.summary: Recommendation to conduct a public hearing to review the proposed revision of the Annual Plan (2022), receive supporting documentation into the record, and conclude the hearing; and, adopt Resolution to certify the revised Annual Plan, and authorize the Deputy Executive Director to transmit them to the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD).  (Citywide) A motion was made by Commissioner Austin, seconded by Vice Chair Saro, to approve recommendation and adopt Resolution No. H.A. 05-22. The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 10 - Allen, Price, Supernaw, Mungo, Uranga, Austin, Richardson, Tanzer, Saro and ZendejasEnactment No: H.A. 07-227.
